posts.content: Just finished teaching a 6-hour workshop on transformer architecture! üß† My students' eyes were glazing over by hour 4, but they powered through! Remember: understanding attention mechanisms is like learning to ride a bike - painful at first, but once you get it, you never forget it. #MachineLearning #MLX8 #Teaching #Transformers

posts.content: Teaching moment: A student asked why we use ReLU instead of sigmoid for hidden layers. My answer: 'Because ReLU doesn't kill gradients like sigmoid does. It's like having a conversation vs talking to a wall.' Sometimes the simplest explanations are the best ones. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è #Teaching #ReLU #NeuralNetworks #MLX8

posts.content: üéâ Proud moment: One of my MLX8 students just got hired as an ML Engineer at Google! She started with zero ML knowledge 6 months ago. Now she's building production models. This is why I do what I do. Everyone deserves access to quality ML education. #SuccessStory #MachineLearning #MLX8 #Google #ProudTeacher

media_items.alt_text: Bes celebrating with a student who just got hired, both looking excited and proud

posts.content: Hot take: The 'AI will replace programmers' narrative is mostly fear-mongering. AI will replace bad programmers who just copy-paste from Stack Overflow. Good programmers who understand fundamentals, can debug, and think systematically? We're more valuable than ever. Focus on being good, not just fast. #AI #Programming #MachineLearning

media_items.alt_text: Bes giving a passionate talk about AI and programming, gesturing animatedly

posts.content: My Italian side is showing today - just spent 2 hours explaining gradient descent over espresso and cannoli. Student: 'So it's like rolling down a hill?' Me: 'Exactly! But the hill is made of math and the ball is your loss function.' Sometimes the best analogies come with good food. üáÆüáπ #Italian #GradientDescent #Teaching #Cannoli

media_items.alt_text: Bes with espresso and cannoli, drawing gradient descent diagrams on napkin

posts.content: Student feedback that made my day: 'Bes, you make complex ML concepts feel like cooking recipes. Step by step, with clear instructions and lots of encouragement.' This is exactly what I aim for! Teaching should be accessible, practical, and encouraging. #SuccessStory #Teaching #MachineLearning #MLX8

media_items.alt_text: Bes reading student feedback with a big smile, surrounded by teaching materials

posts.content: Just published a new tutorial on building attention mechanisms from scratch! No frameworks, no shortcuts - just pure math and code. posts.content: Fun fact: I once spent 3 days optimizing a model at Meta, only to realize I was using the wrong loss function. My team still hasn't let me live it down. Lesson learned: Always double-check your assumptions, even (especially) when you're in a hurry. #MLWarStories #Meta #LearningFromMistakes #MachineLearning

media_items.alt_text: Bes laughing while telling story, with Meta office background visible

posts.content: Pro tip from my Meta days: when debugging a model that's not converging, the first question should always be 'Did I remember to set requires_grad=True?' I've lost more hours to this than I care to admit. üòÖ #MachineLearning #Debugging #MLX8 #Meta #ProTips

posts.content: Coffee break thought: The best ML engineers I've worked with at Meta weren't the ones with the highest GPAs or the most papers published. They were the ones who could explain complex concepts to a 5-year-old and debug production issues at 3 AM. Communication + problem-solving > pure technical skills #Meta #MachineLearning #Leadership
